column4: I am fresh installing a new ubuntu/windows dual boot.  What order should I install them in?  Windows first?  Also, I am planning to have a paging file partition, an ext3 (ubuntu) partition, an NTFS partition (XP), and a storage partition.  Should I use gparted, fdisk, or windows set up disk to partition these?  Just looking for recommendations, thanks.
install windows first then ubuntu, pagefiles in linux are called swap files
use gparted to set up all your partitions first , it makes for a faster cleaner install all around
